div.p: Dr Rost Reinhold Rost (1822-1896), Bibliothekar u. Orientalist; vgl. HSA 09722-09797. has written to me that you expect from me some books published last year by Schön, Stuart and Williams: I have referred to your last letter of Jan 16, and know not what you wish: Please name the books.Nicht identifiziert.

Archdeacon JohnsonSollte „Crowther“ gemeint sein? Es gibt allerdings auch einen sprachenkundigen anglikanischen Missionar William Percival Jones (1854-1928), der von der Isle of Wight stammt, also kein „Negro“ war. Er übersetzte gemeinsam mit Arthur Glossop (1867-1949) das Book of Common Prayer ins Chinyanja (1897, durchges. Ausg. 1909) und wurde später Archdeacon of Nyasa. (the Negro) will be in London in a few days.

Many thanks for the Creolische Studien Part VI
Schuchardt, „Kreolische Studien VI. Ueber das Indoportugiesische von Mangalore“, Sitzungsberichte der philosophisch-historischen Classe der Kaiserlichen Akademie der Wissenschaften. Wien 105, 1884, 881-904.

I conclude you have seen Whitneys (of New Haven) paper in the America Philological Transactions on „Mixture of Languages“
W. D. Whitney, „On Mixture in Languages“, Transactions of the American Philological Association 12, 1881, 5-26.
There is a paper on Kurdo Jewish by Löwy in J of Soc Biblical Archaeology 1877
Albert Löwy, „On Kurdish Folk Lore in the Kurdo-Jewish Dialect“, Transactions of the Society of Biblical Archaeology 6, 1878, 600-602.

See also Haldeman Pennsylvania Dutch Philadelphia U. S. 1873
Samuel Stehman Haldeman, Pennsylvania Dutch a dialect of South German with an infusion of English, London: Trübner, 1872.
I have a review of it –

See also „Sailor’s Language“ Clark Russell, Sampson Low, 1883
W. Clark Russel, Sailors‘ Language, a collection of sea-terms and their definitions, London: Sampson Low, 1883.

Also Laskari Dictionary Nautical Terms – Roebuck Allen – 1882 5 th Edition
An English and Hindostanee Naval Dictionary. A Laskari Dictionary of Anglo-Indian vocabulary of nautical terms and phrases in English and Hindustani
. Orig. comp. by Capt. Thomas Roebuck, rev. And corr. By William Carmichael Smyth, and now carefkully re-ed. And enl. by George Small, London: Allen, (1882).
